snippet: If the mayor is going to keep his promise and end the city’s crisis of inequality and housing unaffordability, he must go big. And it looks as if he’s doing so.
abstract: Editorial welcomes New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's $41 billion housing plan; says it meets the large-scale rhetoric of his pledge to end city's crisis of inequality and housing unaffordability; holds proposal raises a host of serious questions, especially concerning the effect of high-rise, high-density construction on quality of life and infrastructure.
lead_paragraph: If the mayor is going to keep his promise and end the city’s crisis of inequality and housing unaffordability, he must go big. And it looks as if he’s doing so.
